name: Boulder Dash
overview:
Boulder Dash (バルダーダッシュ Barudā Dasshu?), This was the first Arcade version of Boulder dash in 1985, later releases by Data East in 1990 was more advanced. But both were designed and programmed by: Peter Liepa and Chris Gray.

The game's protagonist is called "Rockford". Rockford digs feverishly, as boulders crash down all around him, throughout 16 mystical caves and five levels of difficulty. It runs on the "DECO Cassette System" hardware and is the 44th came in that series.
